summary: Merete Muff Rosen was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in 1977. Payroll certifications from January, October, and November 1977 list her as a committee staff member. A collection of personnel records specifically related to Rosen includes payroll authorizations, a relationship disclosure form, a leave record, and an inquiry regarding her character and qualifications. These documents collectively provide a snapshot of her employment during that year.
significance: Merete Muff Rosen's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the documents provide administrative details about her employment, they do not explicitly state her role in the investigation itself. Her personnel records and payroll information contribute to the overall documentation of the HSCA's operations and staffing.
